unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Real World Binomial Situations
question_text: Which of the following situations could be described with the binomial distribution?

choices.text: Roll a fair dice until a prime number results.
Select $30$ subjects and record their weights.
Roll a fair dice $10$ times and record the number of prime numbers rolled.
Roll a fair die $10$ times and record the numbers rolled.
Select a field-goal kicker in a professional football league and record the number of successful field goals kicked in a given season.

solution:
Binomial distributions must satisfy the following four conditions:

Choice 'C' satisfies all of the conditions listed above.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; this does not have a fixed number of trials.

Choices 'B' and 'D' are incorrect; they have more than $2$ outcomes.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; the probabilities are not all the same for this situation.
